title: EastEnders spoilers: Martin is injured in crime spree with Ben
text:
Ben and Martin (Picture: BBC)

Martin Fowler (James Bye) and Ben Mitchell (Max Bowden) have become Walford’s oddest criminal duo in EastEnders, and the pair continue their alliance — against Martin’s will, of course — in the coming episodes, and the fruit-and-veg stall owner finds himself the victim of a heinous attack as a result.

After getting wind of Bex’s (Jasmine Armfield) suicide attempt, Martin returned home to the Square, and — after much deliberation — he decided to stay put since his daughter needed him.

Following this, he appealed to Ben’s better nature, hoping that the young lad would dispose go of the wrench Stacey (Lacey Turner) used to bludgeon Phil, and allow for her to return home.

Never one to miss an opportunity, Ben has used the leverage he has to convince Martin to help him out with his dodgy dealings, promising him that — in return for his services — he’ll allow Stacey to come back to the Square.

Martin’s unintended alliance with the Mitchell lad continues in the coming episodes, and he heads off to a collection job on behalf of his new partner.

However, disaster strikes later in the week when a pick-up with Tubbs spirals out of control, and Martin ends up getting injured as a result. Due to the operation having gone haywire, he misses Bex’s mental health appointment.

Sonia (Natalie Cassidy) is horrified when she sees the extent of Martin’s injuries, and demands that he go to A&E to get sorted out. However, he refuses to do so, which results in Sonia berating him for his lack of consideration for Bex.

Will Martin continue to work with Ben? Or will this attack prove to be the wake-up call he needs to call his alliance with the young man a day?

If he decides on the latter option, the biggest question is: will Ben allow Stacey to come home?

One to watch: Thursday 17th October at 7:30pm on BBC One.
